bank_profile.report_source: Public filings + Client-provided questionnaire (Nov 2025) + Discovery transcript (Nov 14, 2025)

key_metrics.source: CLIENT DATA — Tom Holdren cited explicitly in Nov 14 demo (00:45:36)

derived_metrics.derivation: $8.27B consumer deposits × 3.0% NIM / 344K accounts ≈ $721; rounded down to $700 as conservative anchor for retention/acquisition levers

data_gaps.impact: Servicing deflection lever sizing — model uses 360,000/yr estimate from 220K digitally active × 35% call propensity × 3 calls/yr; validate with COO/Ops
SMB onboarding lever baseline — model uses 700 accounts/yr as estimate; actual figure changes lever value proportionally

data_gaps.data_needed: Call center average handle time and FTE cost
data_gaps.impact: Used $10/call blended fully-loaded; validate for accuracy
Cross-sell lever assumes uniform 2.3 products/customer; segmented data would refine addressable population

data_gaps.data_needed: Annual Report financial data (C/I ratio, NII, ROE)
data_gaps.impact: Required for reasonableness checks and executive benchmark comparisons

investment.notes: Source: ESTIMATE — validate with Backbase pricing team. License reflects SaaS ACV for a ~$17B community bank. Implementation is front-loaded to reflect CEB deprecation urgency (September 2026 deadline). Year 1 implementation includes platform migration, digital onboarding, and core servicing journeys. Year 2 covers SMB digital banking and cross-sell capabilities.

annual_lost_apps.assumption: 1,600 app starts/month - 140 funded/month = 1,460 abandoned/month × 12 = 17,520/year. Tom Holdren cited 91% abandonment rate at 00:45:36 in Nov 14 demo.

revenue_per_customer_relationship.assumption: Full relationship value: $8.27B consumer deposits × 3.0% NIM / 344K accounts ≈ $721; rounded to $700 conservative. NOTE: CLIENT DATA states $350/year net revenue — the higher figure reflects NIM contribution which is the economic case for retention. Validate with CFO.

backbase_impact.assumption: Gap-based: Client current funded rate = 8.75% (140/1,600). Best-in-class digital onboarding funded rate = 60% (neobanks/DBS). Gap = (60%-8.75%)/60% = 85.4%. Capture rate = 0.18 (conservative — WSFS fraud dial is set very conservatively per transcript; behavior change takes time; not all abandoned apps are recoverable intent). backbase_impact = 85.4% × 0.18 ≈ 0.15. This means Backbase helps convert ~2,628 additional accounts/year (15% of 17,520 lost). Backbase enabler: Digital Onboarding journeys with pre-filled KYC via Alloy integration, streamlined mobile-first application flow.

consumer_call_center_baseline.assumption: 220,000 digitally active consumers × 35% annual call propensity × 3 calls/year = 231,000 calls + non-digital base: total ~360,000 calls/year. Fully loaded cost $10/call (8 min × $15/hr FTE + overhead). Baseline = $3,600,000. SOURCE: Bailey DeLellis confirmed 'customer support is primarily call center driven, lacking live chat or secure messaging' (00:22:00). Validate call volume with Operations.

branch_visits_baseline.assumption: 344,000 accounts × 15% visit for simple tasks × 2 visits/year = 103,200 branch visits/year for deflectable tasks (paying credit cards, account inquiries, simple changes). Cost per visit $15 (15 min at $30/hr staff + overhead). Bailey DeLellis cited 'high volume of branch visits for simple transactional tasks like paying credit cards' (00:39:35).

smb_servicing_baseline.assumption: 4,500 SMB servicing requests/month (midpoint of 4,000-5,000 CLIENT DATA) × 12 = 54,000/year. Average handling time 15 min at $40/hr (ops FTE rate) = $10/request. Baseline = $540,000 ops cost. Wire issues frequently require support request per transcript (00:15:16). Using $20/request to account for RM escalation = $1,080,000/year.

backbase_impact.assumption: Gap-based: WSFS current digital self-service rate ~20% (call-center-driven, minimal live chat/secure messaging per transcript). Best-in-class community banks with digital banking: 65% self-service rate. Gap = (65%-20%)/65% = 69.2%. Capture rate = 0.36. backbase_impact = 69.2% × 0.36 ≈ 0.25. Servicing curve ramps faster as it's operationally driven. Backbase enabler: Self-service journeys (account management, payments, wire initiation), push notifications, secure messaging, in-app card management — addressing transcript pain points: bill pay complexity, wire initiation friction, no push notifications (00:16:31).

tasks.task: Account Profile Changes (address, alerts, user ID)

customer_retention.group_name: Customer Retention — Digital Engagement & Churn Reduction

annual_churning_customers.assumption: CLIENT DATA: attrition < 6% on 344,000 consumer accounts. Using 6% as ceiling: 344,000 × 0.06 = 20,640 customers leaving per year. The Nov 14 transcript noted AUM is increasing while account count is decreasing, confirming churn and failure to attract Gen Z/Millennials (00:44:36).

full_relationship_value.assumption: Full NIM-based relationship value: $8.27B consumer deposits × 3.0% NIM / 344K = $721; rounded to $700 conservative. The attrition lever captures the full relationship value lost (not just fee income), because a churning customer takes their deposits and relationship. Validate with CFO.

backbase_impact.assumption: Gap-based: WSFS current attrition 6%. Best-in-class digital-first community banks: 2% attrition. Gap = (6%-2%)/6% = 66.7%. Capture rate = 0.30 (digital engagement reduces attrition through better UX, proactive notifications, self-service; however, many churn factors are non-digital — product pricing, branch access, life events). backbase_impact = 66.7% × 0.30 = 0.20. This retains ~4,128 additional customers/year at steady state. Churn lever has delayed onset — 0% Year 1 (platform must be deployed and adopted before behavioral change occurs). Backbase enabler: Digital Engage (personalized notifications, NBA), self-service retention, loyalty programs, proactive alerts for at-risk customers.

smb_digital_onboarding.group_name: SMB Digital Onboarding — Manual Process Efficiency

annual_new_smb_accounts.assumption: ESTIMATE — no direct client data on new SMB account volumes. Derived from WSFS SMB deposit base ($1.89B) ÷ avg SMB relationship $2.7M = ~700 SMB clients. Assuming 100% annual turnover/replacement (10% growth + attrition) = ~700 new accounts/year. Validate with Head of SMB Banking. Flag: LOW confidence — model is proportionally sensitive to this number.

avg_onboarding_cost_per_account.assumption: CLIENT DATA: RM 7.5-15h @ $75/hr + Ops 10-20h @ $40/hr + Compliance 4-8h @ $40/hr. Midpoints: RM $843.75 + Ops $600 + Compliance $240 = $1,683.75. Range: $1,485–$2,485. Using midpoint $1,985/account. These costs are confirmed as fully manual process — no digital workflow exists per discovery.

backbase_impact.assumption: Gap-based: WSFS onboarding is 100% manual (confirmed: RM-led, no digital workflow). Best-in-class SMB digital onboarding: 60% process automation achievable. Gap = 100% manual. Capture rate = 0.30 (RM relationship element cannot be eliminated; compliance review remains human; platform automates data capture, document collection, ID verification). backbase_impact = 1.0 × 0.30 = 0.30. This saves ~$596/account in labor (30% of $1,985). Backbase enabler: SMB Digital Onboarding — digital application flow, pre-populated KYC via Alloy, document upload, automated compliance checks, RM dashboard for case management. Addresses transcript pain points: RM time burden, manual compliance steps.

addressable_customers.assumption: Full consumer base: 344,000 accounts. All digitally engaged customers are addressable for cross-sell via NBA (Next Best Action) features and proactive digital prompts. NOTE: Only ~65% (220,000) are currently digitally active — model applies to full base as target state.

products_gap_per_customer.assumption: CLIENT DATA: 2.3 avg products/customer. BENCHMARK (industry best-in-class for community banks with strong digital engagement): 3.2 products/customer. Gap = 3.2 - 2.3 = 0.9 products/customer. NOTE: Full closure of gap is not realistic in a 5-year model — the backbase_impact captures the realistic portion Backbase can drive.

avg_product_revenue_per_year.assumption: Derived: $350 net revenue per customer / 2.3 products = $152/product/year net. This represents marginal net revenue per incremental product added (checking, savings, CD, credit card, mortgage, LOC). Conservative — some products yield more (mortgages), some less (savings accounts).

backbase_impact.assumption: Gap-based: Current 2.3 vs best-in-class 3.2 = gap of 0.9 products = 28.1% of the 3.2 target. Capture rate = 0.28 (digital cross-sell is a nudge, not a guarantee; customer willingness, product fit, credit underwriting all constrain uptake; 5-year horizon). backbase_impact = 28.1% × 0.28 ≈ 0.08. Steady-state: 344,000 × 0.9 × 0.08 = 24,768 incremental products → $3.77M incremental revenue at $152/product/yr. Low confidence: cross-sell impact highly dependent on NBA engine configuration, product portfolio competitiveness, and digital adoption rate. Product penetration curve has 0% Year 1 (requires platform maturity + adoption). Backbase enabler: Digital Engage (NBA cross-sell prompts), personalized product recommendations, digital product onboarding within the app — addressing the lack of digital cross-sell capability identified in transcript (no personalization, no proactive engagement features on current platform).

lever_summary.name: Consumer App Abandonment Recovery
lever_summary.current_state: 91% abandonment rate; 1,460 of 1,600 monthly apps never funded
lever_summary.change_driver: Backbase Digital Onboarding — mobile-first, KYC via Alloy, streamlined flow
lever_summary.target_state: Recover 15% of lost apps (2,628/yr) → $1.84M incremental annual revenue
lever_summary.benchmark: DBS Bank: 90%+ digital onboarding completion, <10 min (DBS Annual Report 2024)

lever_summary.name: Branch & Call Center Deflection
lever_summary.current_state: Call-center-driven support; no live chat, no push notifications, wire requires support ticket
lever_summary.change_driver: Backbase self-service journeys: payments, wire initiation, account management, secure messaging
lever_summary.target_state: Deflect 25% of servicing cost ($1.56M/yr) from call center and branch
lever_summary.benchmark: Leading community banks: 65% self-service rate vs WSFS ~20% (Source: Cornerstone Advisors 2024)

lever_summary.name: Customer Retention — Digital Engagement
lever_summary.current_state: 6% annual attrition (20,640 customers/yr); AUM up but account count declining (Gen Z/Millennial gap)
lever_summary.change_driver: Backbase Digital Engage: proactive alerts, NBA retention nudges, personalized UX
lever_summary.target_state: Reduce attrition by 20% → retain ~4,128 additional customers/yr ($2.89M revenue protected)
lever_summary.benchmark: Digital-first community banks: 2% attrition vs WSFS 6% (Source: BAI Banking Outlook 2024)

lever_summary.name: SMB Digital Onboarding Efficiency
lever_summary.current_state: 100% manual SMB onboarding: RM 7.5-15h + Ops 10-20h + Compliance 4-8h = $1,485-$2,485/account
lever_summary.change_driver: Backbase SMB Digital Onboarding: digital application, KYC automation, RM dashboard
lever_summary.target_state: Reduce onboarding labor 30% → save $596/account, ~$497K/yr at 700 accounts/year
lever_summary.benchmark: Best-in-class SMB digital banks: 60% process automation, <2h total onboarding time (Cornerstone 2024)

lever_summary.name: Cross-sell & Product Deepening
lever_summary.current_state: 2.3 products/customer; no NBA engine; no proactive digital cross-sell capability
lever_summary.change_driver: Backbase Digital Engage NBA: contextual product offers, digital product onboarding in-app
lever_summary.target_state: Grow products/customer toward 2.57 (+0.27 via Backbase) → $3.76M incremental revenue/yr (steady state)
lever_summary.benchmark: Community banks with NBA digital: 3.2 products/customer; WSFS gap = 0.9 products (Source: BAI 2024)

assumptions_register.value: 91% (1,460 of 1,600 apps per month don't fund)
assumptions_register.source: CLIENT DATA — Tom Holdren explicitly cited in Nov 14, 2025 demo transcript (00:45:36)
assumptions_register.sensitivity: HIGH — this is the anchor metric for Lever 1; a 10% change in abandonment rate shifts L1 baseline by ~$1.2M

assumptions_register.value: $350/customer/year (net fee/service income); $700 used for retention/acquisition levers (full NIM-based relationship value)
assumptions_register.source: $350 = CLIENT DATA. $700 = DERIVED (NIM calculation). Validate higher figure with CFO.
assumptions_register.sensitivity: HIGH — if true relationship value is closer to $350, steady-state benefit drops by ~40%

assumptions_register.value: 6% (CLIENT DATA states <6%; model uses 6% as ceiling)
assumptions_register.sensitivity: MEDIUM — if actual attrition is 4% rather than 6%, Lever 3 baseline drops 33%

assumptions_register.source: DERIVED — average deposit is an industry benchmark; actual count not provided
assumptions_register.sensitivity: HIGH — affects all per-customer calculations across all 5 levers

assumptions_register.source: ESTIMATE — no client data provided. Derived from SMB deposit base / average relationship size.
assumptions_register.sensitivity: HIGH — L4 baseline is directly proportional to this number; validate as priority

assumptions_register.source: ESTIMATE — Bailey DeLellis confirmed call-center-driven support model (00:22:00); volume derived from digital adoption rate and industry ratios
assumptions_register.sensitivity: MEDIUM — L2 baseline is $3.6M for call center component; ±50% range gives $1.8M–$5.4M
LOW — range is known; midpoint is defensible

assumptions_register.value: September 2026 deadline — confirms budget and executive approval trajectory
assumptions_register.sensitivity: LOW — timeline context only; does not affect financial model

assumptions_register.source: INDUSTRY BENCHMARK — digital-native and leading community bank benchmarks
assumptions_register.sensitivity: MEDIUM — if best-in-class is 40% instead of 60%, capture rate changes but impact on L1 is modest (<10%)

assumptions_register.source: INDUSTRY BENCHMARK — BAI Banking Outlook, Cornerstone Advisors community bank digital study
assumptions_register.sensitivity: LOW — L5 cross-sell is flagged LOW confidence overall; this assumption only affects the gap sizing, not the final captured benefit materially

data_gaps_for_validation.data_needed: Exact annual new SMB account volume
data_gaps_for_validation.source: Head of SMB Banking — CRM / core system
data_gaps_for_validation.impact: L4 (SMB Onboarding) baseline is $1.66M — a 50% error in account volume causes a $248K/year error in steady-state benefit

data_gaps_for_validation.data_needed: Annual consumer call center call volume
data_gaps_for_validation.source: COO / Operations — call center reporting system
data_gaps_for_validation.impact: L2 (Servicing Deflection) baseline includes $3.6M call center component based on estimate; actual volume validates or shifts this significantly

data_gaps_for_validation.data_needed: Annual branch visit count for deflectable tasks
data_gaps_for_validation.impact: L2 branch component ($1.55M) is estimated; actual visit volumes for simple tasks (payments, account changes) refine the baseline

data_gaps_for_validation.data_needed: True fully-loaded revenue per consumer relationship (NIM-based)
data_gaps_for_validation.source: CFO — management accounts or segment P&L
data_gaps_for_validation.impact: Model uses $700 for retention/acquisition levers; if CFO confirms closer to $350, 5-year benefits decrease by approximately $6M

data_gaps_for_validation.data_needed: Current products per customer (segmented by digital adoption)
data_gaps_for_validation.impact: L5 (Cross-sell) assumes uniform 2.3 products; digitally active customers likely have different ratios; segmentation refines addressable market

data_gaps_for_validation.data_needed: Consumer attrition segmentation by digital engagement status
data_gaps_for_validation.impact: If digitally active customers already attrite at <3% vs non-digital at >9%, the L3 lever should be scoped to at-risk non-digital segment only
Would add a cost-efficiency dimension to L1 (abandonment recovery is more cost-effective than paid acquisition); strengthens ROI case
